service.name: RAS
service.informativeText: Ranging Service (RAS) is a Generic Attribute Profile (GATT) service intended for providing Ranging Data to a client. Ranging Data is the Channel Sounding (CS) Procedure results that are generated by a Core Controller and sent to the Host via HCI LE CS Subevent Result and Subevent Result Continue events. Ranging Data can be used by the client to perform a distance estimation.

characteristic.name: RAS Features
characteristic.informativeText: The RAS Features characteristic is used to describe the supported features of the RAS Server.

characteristic.name: Real-time Ranging Data
characteristic.informativeText: The Real-time Ranging Data characteristic is used to report received Ranging Data to a client using indications or notifications. A client can enable notifications or indications by subscribing to either notifications or indications of the Real-time Ranging Data characteristic by writing to the CCC descriptor associated with the On-demand Ranging Data characteristics.

descriptor.name: Client Characteristic Configuration
descriptor.informativeText:
Abstract: The Client Characteristic Configuration descriptor defines how the characteristic may be configured by a specific client.
Summary: This descriptor is not persistent across connections for bonded devices. The Client Characteristic Configuration descriptor is unique for each client. A client may read and write this descriptor to determine and set the configuration for that client. Authentication and authorization may be required by the server to write this descriptor. The default value for the Client Characteristic Configuration descriptor is 0x00. Upon connection, this descriptor is set to the default value.

characteristic.name: On-demand Ranging Data
characteristic.informativeText: The On-demand Ranging Data characteristic is used to report Ranging Data On-demand to a client using the RAS-CP procedure. The On-demand Ranging Data characteristic shall be indicated or notified to a client, in a segmented fashion, as the response to a RAS-CP command from a client to retrieve the pending Ranging Data from the RAS Server. A client can enable notifications or indications by subscribing to either notifications or indications of the On-demand Ranging Data characteristic by writing to the CCC descriptor associated with the On-demand Ranging Data characteristics. If a portion or the entire unread Ranging Data is overwritten by new Ranging Data, the RAS Server shall indicate or notify Ranging Data Overwritten

characteristic.name: RAS-CP
characteristic.informativeText: The RAS-CP characteristic allows a client to write commands to the RAS Server and to receive indications from the RAS Server. The On-demand Ranging Data can be retrieved using a Ranging Counter that is indicated beforehand by the RAS Server using the Ranging Data Ready indication. In addition, it allows the client to update the RAS Server that all the Ranging Data notifications are received, and to request retransmission of lost Ranging Data segments.

characteristic.name: Ranging Data Ready
characteristic.informativeText: The Ranging Data Ready characteristic shall be used by the RAS Server to inform the availability of Ranging Data to a client. The Ranging Data Ready characteristic shall be used when the RAS Server is configured to operate in the On-demand Ranging Data mode. The indication contains the Ranging Counter of the completed CS Procedure.

characteristic.name: Ranging Data Overwritten
characteristic.informativeText: The Ranging Data Overwritten characteristic shall be used when the RAS Server is configured to operate in the On-demand Ranging Data mode, and pending unread Ranging Data is overwritten by new Ranging Data. The indication contains the Ranging Counter of the completed CS Procedure.
